intro: Solanum lepidocaule, commonly known as the hairy nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, bell-shaped flowers that transition into berries, typically green turning to yellow or red when mature. Solanum lepidocaule is often found in moist, shaded environments and can be invasive in certain regions.
